author: Simon Rice
title: Manchester United put Arsenal in position they’ve not been for over a decade
text:
Arsene Wenger’s side are in the midst of a crisis that’s just been made worse (Getty) Arsenal find themselves in the lowest league position theyâ€™ve been at this stage of the season for over a decade.
Manchester Unitedâ€™s 3-1 victory over Middlesbrough on Sunday coupled with Arsenalâ€™s horrendous run of form has seen the Gunners drop to sixth in the Premier League table .
Manchester United make Premier League history with win over Middlesbrough It puts Champions League qualification â€“ something achieved in every full season under Arsene Wenger â€“ under real threat.
The seriousness of Arsenalâ€™s situation is highlighted by how long itâ€™s been since they were this low in the table at this stage of the season.
Not since the 2005/06 campaign have Arsenal been below fifth this late in the campaign. That year the Gunners were sixth after 32 games and only managed to finish fourth on the final day of the season courtesy of Tottenham suffering a defeat to West Ham amid a spate of food poisoning.
Arsenal consistently mixing it at the topâ€Ś 2016/17: Had been 5th since five games into season prior to today.
2015/16: 4th or above after seven games of the season â€“ finished 2nd.
2014/15: 5th or above after 24 games of the season â€“ finished 3rd.
2013/14: 4th or above three games into season â€“ finished 4th.
2012/13: 5th or above after 26 games â€“ finished 4th.
2011/12: 5th or above after 24 games â€“ ended up 3rd.
2010/11: 4th or above after two games â€“ finished 4th.
2009/10: 5th or above after seven games â€“ finished 3rd.
2008/09: Fifth or above after three games â€“ finished 4th.
2007/08: 3rd or above after three games â€“ finished 3rd.
2006/07: 5th or above after 17 games â€“ finished 4th.
2005/06: 6th after 32 games â€“ moved up to 5th after 33 games â€“ finished 4th.

Arsenal have lost four of their last five Premier League games, a situation unprecedented in Wengerâ€™s 21 years in charge of the club. The latest defeat increased the pressure on the Frenchman to announce whether he plans to remain in charge beyond this season.
